project: Web “New Session” Reliability + Dark Theme CSS Overhaul
description: In the web app’s “New Session” flow, selecting a folder and clicking **Select** can trigger a server error (`Project path does not exist`) even when the folder is valid. Separately, the UI has severe contrast issues (e.g. chat/PRD text appearing white-on-white), and the overall styling needs a cohesive dark-theme polish.

stories.title: File picker selection vs navigation
stories.description: As a** web user I want** single click to select a folder and double click to enter it So that** I can quickly choose a repo root without losing browsing ability
acceptance_criteria: Single click updates the “Project path” input with the clicked folder’s absolute server path
Double click navigates into the folder and updates the folder listing
Verify in browser
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Server-side path validation (exists/dir/git) with debounce
stories.description: As a** web user I want** the app to validate the typed/selected path against the server every 500ms after I stop typing So that** I can’t proceed with an invalid repo path
acceptance_criteria: Validation runs 500ms after last keystroke; further typing resets the timer
Validation checks: exists, is directory, and git command confirms repo
Validation result updates UI state without page refresh
Verify in browser
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Disable “Select” until path is valid
stories.description: As a** web user I want** the Select button disabled unless the current path is a valid git repo directory So that** I don’t trigger server errors from invalid input
acceptance_criteria: Select is disabled when path is empty/invalid
Select becomes enabled only when server validation is successful
If a previously valid path becomes invalid, Select becomes disabled again
Verify in browser
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Lock in selected path on “Select”
stories.description: As a** web user I want** clicking Select to lock in the validated repo path So that** “Create session” depends on an explicit confirmed selection, not transient text
acceptance_criteria: Clicking Select stores a “locked” project path value used for session creation
Changing the text afterward does not change the locked value unless Select is clicked again
Verify in browser
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Explicit “Create session” button gated by required options
stories.description: As a** web user I want** a Create session button that is disabled until required options are set (including locked repo path) So that** session creation is intentional and predictable
acceptance_criteria: Create session exists as a distinct action from Select
Create session is disabled until required fields are set and project path is locked
Clicking Create session successfully creates a session for a valid locked repo path
Verify in browser
Typecheck passes

stories.title: Web-wide CSS overhaul to cohesive dark theme + fix contrast bugs
stories.description: As a** web user I want** the entire web app restyled into a readable dark theme So that** all text (especially chat/PRD text) is visible and the app looks polished
acceptance_criteria: Chat/PRD text is clearly readable (no white-on-white or similar contrast failures)
Core pages (dashboard/session/new session) have consistent dark styling (backgrounds, surfaces, text, inputs, buttons)
Verify in browser
Typecheck passes
